intro: Papaver argemone var. hybridum, commonly known as the hybrid poppy, is a variant of the argemone poppy native to southern Europe and western Asia. This plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The flowers are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous small, oily seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used historically in traditional medicine and as a source of oil.
